column4: I have a second hard drive and plan to just use it for Virtual Machines.. should I just make it Extended ??
you don't make a hard drive extended. You make partitions extended. And no, it doesn't really matter (just remember, only 4 primary partitions allowed per hard drive)
its not going to boot.. just used as a slave for vm's..
and you can create a new partition as Primary or Extended.. which is preferred in my situation??
doesn't matter, you can't make a harddrive extended. Partitions, yes
im not trying to make the 'harddrive' extended
im asking what type of partition should I FORMAT this harddrive with.. if its a slave, being used for just virtual machines and not an OS...
oh, ext3 is fine for almost everything
what TYPE OF PARTITION.. if you said "Primary" i would use the ext3 filesystem.. but your not answering what im asking
because you can't ask decent questions?
*sigh* in an effort to stir this into something useful.. can you explain the differences between Primary vs Extended partitions as it pretains to my situation???

if you're using it for just data, it doesn't matter if you use primary or extended partitions. there is no "real" difference except that you can only have up to 4 primary partitions, and unlimited (as long as you have the space) extended partitions
